verses.verse: Set the trumpet <S%H7782><s%> to your mouth <S%H2441><s%>. He shall come as a eagle <S%H5404><s%> against the house <S%H1004><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%>, because they have transgressed <S%H5674><s%> my covenant <S%H1285><s%>, and trespassed <S%H6586><s%> against my law <S%H8451><s%>.
Israel <S%H3478><s%> shall cry <S%H2199><s%> unto me <S%H430><s%>, My God, we know you <S%H3045><s%>.
Israel <S%H3478><s%> has cast off <S%H2186><s%> the thing that is good <S%H2896><s%>: the enemy <S%H341><s%> shall pursue him <S%H7291><s%>.

They have set up kings <S%H4427><s%>, but not by me <S%H7786><s%>: they have made princes, and I knew <S%H3045><s%> it not <S%H3701><s%>: of their silver and their gold <S%H2091><s%> have they made <S%H6213><s%> them idols <S%H6091><s%>, that they may be cut off <S%H3772><s%>.

Your calf <S%H5695><s%>, O Samaria <S%H8111><s%>, has cast <S%H2186><s%> you off <S%H639><s%>; my anger is kindled <S%H2734><s%> against them <S%H3808><s%>: how long will it be before they attain <S%H3201><s%> to innocence <S%H5356><s%>?

For from Israel <S%H3478><s%> was it also <S%H2796><s%>: the workman made <S%H6213><s%> it <S%H430><s%>; therefore it is not God: but the calf <S%H5695><s%> of Samaria <S%H8111><s%> shall be broken in pieces <S%H7616><s%>.

For they have sown <S%H2232><s%> the wind <S%H7307><s%>, and they shall reap <S%H7114><s%> the whirlwind <S%H5492><s%>: it has no stalk <S%H7054><s%>: the bud <S%H6780><s%> shall yield <S%H6213><s%> no meal <S%H7058><s%>: if <S%H194><s%> so be it yield <S%H6213><s%>, the strangers <S%H2114><s%> shall swallow it up <S%H1104><s%>.
Israel <S%H3478><s%> is swallowed up <S%H1104><s%>: now shall they be among the Nations <S%H1471><s%> as a vessel <S%H3627><s%> where is no pleasure <S%H2656><s%>.
For they are gone up <S%H5927><s%> to Assyria <S%H804><s%>, a wild donkey <S%H6501><s%> alone <S%H909><s%> by himself <S%H669><s%>: Ephraim has hired <S%H8566><s%> lovers <S%H158><s%>.

Yes <S%H8566><s%>, though they have hired among the nations <S%H1471><s%>, now will I gather <S%H6908><s%> them <S%H2490><s%>, and they shall sorrow a little <S%H4592><s%> for the burden <S%H4853><s%> of the king <S%H4428><s%> of princes <S%H8269><s%>.
Because Ephraim <S%H669><s%> has made many <S%H7235><s%> altars <S%H4196><s%> to sin <S%H2398><s%>, altars <S%H4196><s%> shall be unto him to sin <S%H2398><s%>.
I have written <S%H3789><s%> to him the great things <S%H7230><s%> of my law <S%H8451><s%>, but they were counted <S%H2803><s%> as a strange thing <S%H2114><s%>.

They sacrifice <S%H2076><s%> flesh <S%H1320><s%> for the sacrifices <S%H2077><s%> of my offerings <S%H1890><s%>, and eat <S%H398><s%> it <S%H3068><s%>; but the Lord accepts <S%H7521><s%> them not <S%H2142><s%>; now will he remember their iniquity <S%H5771><s%>, and visit <S%H6485><s%> their sins <S%H2403><s%>: they shall return <S%H7725><s%> to Egypt <S%H4714><s%>.

For Israel <S%H3478><s%> has forgotten <S%H7911><s%> his Maker <S%H6213><s%>, and builds <S%H1129><s%> temples <S%H1964><s%>; and Judah <S%H3063><s%> has multiplied <S%H7235><s%> fenced <S%H1219><s%> cities <S%H5892><s%>: but I will send <S%H7971><s%> a fire <S%H784><s%> upon his cities <S%H5892><s%>, and it shall devour <S%H398><s%> the palaces there <S%H759><s%>.
